metadata.Title: CVE-2014-4000 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Cacti before 1.0.0 allows remote authenticated users to conduct PHP object injection attacks and execute arbitrary PHP code via a crafted serialized object, related to calling unserialize(stripslashes()).

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-4000` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

cacti - 0.8.8f+ds1-4ubuntu4.16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: cacti package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.8.8f+ds1-4ubuntu4.16.04.1').
